Message.Title: 300 or so Mexican citizens have been mowed down with Fast and Furious weapons
Message.Msg: Obama asserted executive priviledge over the documents of his criminal Fast and Furious scandal. This has been silenced and downplayed by mainstream media..... Gowdy said that the next steps on Fast and Furious need to come from the media. “You can report it and put pressure on the White House and the Department of Justice to give us the documents they haven’t given us,” he said. Fast and Furious weapons were used in the murders of Border Patrol agent Brian Terry in December 2010, and have been used in numerous crimes south of the border for years – and clearly are continually being used. Mario Gonzalez, the brother of Mexican government official Patricia Gonzalez, was murdered with those weapons. So were several teenagers, who were massacred at a birthday party with the weapons President Barack Obama’s administration gave the cartels. An estimated 300 or so Mexican citizens have been mowed down with Fast and Furious weapons. The cartels got the weapons because Attorney General Eric Holder’s Department of Justice and its Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives “walked” the AK-47s and other rifles into Mexico. That means they didn’t interdict the weapons they knew were being trafficked to cartels by straw purchasers. Straw purchasers are people who purchase guns for criminals and others who wouldn’t pass the basic background checks that would allow them to buy weapons. It’s illegal to straw purchase firearms because, when someone purchases a weapon, they sign an ATF form that requires them to declare the weapon is for them. Since they’re buying the weapon for someone else, they’re lying on federal forms – which is a crime. At the orders of higher-ups in the Obama administration’s Department of Justice and ATF, agents allowed these purchases to happen and didn’t stop the guns from getting into Mexico, even though they easily could have intercepted them. Holder is in both criminal and civil contempt of Congress for his failure to cooperate with a congressional investigation into Fast and Furious. He and President Obama are hiding tens of thousands of pages of Fast and Furious documents from the American people and the Congress; Obama has asserted executive privilege over those documents.

Emotions allow a person to hold conflicting opinions about related topics. Such as Women should have access to the morning after pill sold over the counter, but birth control pills should not be sold over the counter? But then I am using hard logic which a Liberal can't follow because logic wipes away emotion and Liberals can only react / respond emotionally.

Topic.Title: My Ignorant Forecast

Message.Msg: Today the volume was higher. But, it seems that the bears are not even trying to lower it to the $19. The options will expire without a down push, or are they trying and is not moving? If they are trying and is not moving, it could go to $21 next week, after expiration day. What do you think?

Topic.Title: My Ignorant Forecast

Message.Msg: Yeah, the volume has been anemic lately, so interesting that today was back to average. It was an odd day in general. The market is on pins and needle spending every second trying to anticipate what the politicians will say each day about the fiscal cliff. I think today's reaction was mostly about Grover N. letting the republican's off the hook to vote to exclude people making X from the extention of the tax cuts. But every day the market is just tracking what was said - with that much volatility in day to day trading, it's hard to know what will hapen. I honestly think that there is just too litle open interest to heavily steer price action. The open interest at $19 is only about 10% of the daily volume. I just don't think options are driving price action in Yahoo this quarter. There could be a bit of downward pressure on Yahoo tomorrow, but I wouldn't expect any significant movement based on options expiry. But that's just my guess.

Message.Title: YHOO $45 in 2013 – here's why
Message.Msg: Only positive media coverage, over exuberance wll make YHOO overshoot to $45 Most stock gurus say YHOO will be a winner in 2013 U cant deny Marissa Mayer is a darling of Wall Street - I dont know why other than shes prettty Last October, Jim Cramer said buy YHOO Eric Jackson explained how YHOO gets to $40. AOL tripled in 2012 from $13 to $43 and nobody saw that happening. YHOO is a momentum stock and they all go crazy to the upside

Topic.Title: My Ignorant Forecast

Message.Msg: I do not foresee correction on YHOO in the near-term. First argument is that YHOO uptrend movements is very, very very gradual. Plus going forward YHOO has many positive issues that protect from the downside such as amticipated upcoming Alibaba IPO probably mid next year with possible announcement in 1Q and possible bigtime surprise news of YHOO and YHOO Japan deal. In addition, small positive news such as signed partnership, Flickr major revamped improvements and continuation of shares buyback from previous share buyback program are helping YHOO to sustain his upward movements. In fairness to your comments, I see a "minor" share correction if YHOO didnot meet analysts consensus estimates for their 4Q report next month. However, I expect YHOO to beat analysts revenue and earnings estimates.
